                                  Copy Function
                                  To adopt all or part of the data of one document for another document, you can
                                  copy the original document. You can choose individual items and enter the
                                  quantities.


                                                     Copy

                                       from                    to

                                       Order                   •    Order
                                                               •    Partial delivery
                                                               •    Complaint
                                                               •    Down payment

                                       from                    to

                                       Quotatio                • Order
                                       n                       • Alternative
                                                                 quotation


                                  Fig. C-128   Examples for the copy function


                                  The copy function is the same for all documents. It is described in connection
                                  with orders in this tutorial.
                                  The copy function is accessible directly from Document management or from
                                  the Number manager. This means that you do not necessarily have to open
                                  the original document.
                                  For orders, you can use the copy function for the following purposes:
                                  •   Transfer quotation into order.
                                  •   Change the order, e.g. to correct an error.
                                  •   Write archived order back to the main database.
                                  In copied documents, you can edit customer and supplier data as well as the
                                  items. If the new document is meant for another customer, customer data is
                                  reimported, and prices and special surcharges are recalculated.
                                  References to the source document will be saved in the history of the new doc-
                                  ument, namely the order and customer number, and the current balance. The
                                  number of the new document is saved as a reference in the history.

                                      Status Allocation when Copying
                                      The status can be changed when a document is copied. This function can be
                                      controlled via user rights. If this right does not exist, new documents will al-
                                      ways show the status of the original document. Documents retrieved from ar-
                                      chives will get the status of the archived document.


                                      Adjustments during Copying
                                      When you copy a document, you can create an identical copy or change cer-
                                      tain details if and as required:
                                      •   Do not copy items
                                      •   Change quantities
                                      •   Change customer
                                      •   Adopt customer but change the shipping address
                                      •   Change supplier for ordered items
                                      •   Edit dates, e. g. delivery date, production date
                                      •   Add text


                                      Copying archived Documents
                                      The copy function can be used to load archived documents back into the main
                                      database. Define that the document is to be saved by its former document
                                      number.
                                      When a document is copied to a new document number, the weight will be up-
                                      dated. This makes sure e.g. that new documents that are based on archived
                                      orders will state the correct weights.
                                      Product data can be reloaded if master data has been edited after the source
                                      document was entered. This makes sure that e. g. prices and product groups
                                      are up to date in the new document.
                                      When you copy an archived order to a credit note, you can enter the reason
                                      and cause of complaint. This will be transferred to the credit note and can be
                                      analyzed in statistics. Credit notes are described in a separate module.
                                       “Credit Notes” on page C-285

                                  Down Payments
                                  Objectives

                                  • Entering down payment as an invoice.
                                  • Entering down payment as an order item.


                                  Benefits

                                  • You can enter different down payments, with or without invoices.
                                  • You can enter the down payment for a customer with whom prepayment has been
                                    agreed.


                                  Note

                                  Down payment              Down payments are entered in A+W Business in the
                                                            following circumstances:
                                                            • Down payment for part of the order total
                                                            • Prepayment
                                                            The down payment results in a down payment item or a
                                                            down payment invoice.

                                  Down payment product      A down payment must be defined as a product in the
                                                            master data.

                                  Down payment item         The down payment item is saved in the order and is only
                                                            invoiced with the final invoice.

                                  Down payment invoice      An order of the type down payment is created for a down
                                                            payment invoice. This order can be invoiced.

                                  Document                  A separate number area is used for down payment
                                                            invoices.
                                                            Down payment invoices can be created in various ways:
                                                            • by copying an order
                                                            • by entering a new document

                                  Default settings          Master data:
                                                            • Number areas
                                                            • Product Down payment for down payment item
                                                            • Product allocation surcharges (down payment)
                                                              (optional)

                                      Invoiced Down Payment
                                      Production of an order may be based on a down payment. There are two meth-
                                      ods of entering and booking these down payments:
                                      •   Down payment invoice
                                      •   Down payment item
                                          This type of down payment is described in the next module.
                                      Down payments can be entered as down payment invoices and automatically
                                      transferred to financial accounting, archives and statistics. If prepayment has
                                      been defined for a customer or a single order, a down payment invoice will be
                                      issued for the order total.
                                      The document Down payment invoice is created by means of the copy func-
                                      tion. It will automatically receive its own document number, which originates
                                      from the partial shipment number area. Further down payment invoices can be
                                      created until the final invoice for this order is issued. Every down payment in-
                                      voice will receive its own invoice number.
                                      In the original order, the down payment amount is shown as a negative item,
                                      automatically reducing the total and the VAT by the down payment amount.
                                      The down payment amount is booked to a separate proceeds account, Down
                                      payment. In statistics, this amount is booked to the allocated product group
                                      Down payment. Only when the original order is transferred to financial ac-
                                      counting and statistics are the proceeds account and product group credited
                                      with the down payment. The original document is booked to the regular ac-
                                      counts and product groups. This ensures that all accounts in statistics and in
                                      financial accounting are duly booked.
                                      The final invoice is created from the original order. After the individual items,
                                      the order form shows the order total, net amount, VAT and gross amount. After
                                      that, all down payment invoices are listed with their individual amounts, i.e. net
                                      amount, VAT and gross amount. The last line shows the remaining invoice
                                      amount.

                                      Down payment invoice
                                      Prior to creating the document Down payment, define whether the items
                                      should be listed on the down payment invoice.




                                      If the original items should not be listed, then only the Down payment item is
                                      included on the down payment invoice.

                                      Complaint Order
                                      Complaints are created by copying from the order. Individual order items or the
                                      entire order can be copied.
                                      Copying produces a complaint order which does not result in an invoice. Com-
                                      plaints have their own number areas.
                                      The complaint results in a complaint order which has to be passed on to pro-
                                      duction and/or purchasing like any other order.
                                      If complaints are free of charge, all surcharges will be deleted automatically.
                                      The original sales price will not be recalculated. It will be analyzed in complaint
                                      statistics.
                                      If the complaint includes items with production dates or purchase articles,
                                      these will be transferred to the corresponding interfaces as for any new order.


                                      Reason and Cause of Complaint
                                      Complaints can be analyzed statistically by defining a reason and cause of
                                      complaint.
                                      Possible reasons and causes of complaints are defined in the master data.




                                      Fig. C-158   Reason for complaint


                                      Possible causes (places) of complaints are for example:
                                      •   Office: data input errors.
                                      •   Production: sheets produced incorrectly.
                                      •   Driver: goods damaged at delivery.

                                      Purchase Orders
                                      In this thematic block you will learn how to process order items containing pur-
                                      chase orders.


                                      Transfer to Purchasing
                                      Objectives

                                      •   Transferring order items with purchase items to the order pool.
                                      •   Checking purchase order in the order pool.
                                      •   Changing supplier and delivery dates.
                                      •   Transferring purchase order to Purchasing.


                                      Benefits

                                      • You can enter order items for which parts have to be purchased. You do not have
                                        to reenter these elements; you can simply transfer the corresponding order items
                                        to purchasing.
                                      • A report from goods received informs you of the changed status of an order item.
                                        This tells you how to process this order further.


                                      Note

                                      Procurement type             The procurement type of a product is defined in the
                                                                   product master data. It can be changed for every single
                                                                   order item.
                                                                   Based on this code, A+W Business recognizes the
                                                                   purchase item and automatically issues a purchase
                                                                   order.

                                      P.O. transfer                The transfer of a purchase order must be triggered
                                                                   manually. Only order items with a P.O. code will be
                                                                   transferred from the order pool to purchasing.

                                      Supplier                     If several items with purchase codes have been entered
                                                                   in an order, a separate purchase order will be issued for
                                                                   every supplier.

                                      Price comparison             Before transferring the purchase order, you can compare
                                                                   the prices of suppliers who can provide the required
                                                                   product. For this purpose, the supplier file must be kept
                                                                   updated.

                                      Change of date               If the delivery date at the customer is changed in the
                                                                   order pool, this change will be applied to the reference
                                                                   order as well.

                                              pered glass 5 mm, the laminated unit will be ordered as a whole. (Please
                                              also note the difference from purchased articles.)
                                          •   Purchased articles:
                                              Only the concerned product is ordered, without taking into account the con-
                                              tent of the bill of material (e.g. processing steps). If, on the other hand, e.g.
                                              a laminated unit consists of a float sheet, a film layer and a tempered sheet
                                              and if the code Purchase Article has now been set for the tempered sheet,

                              Quotation Entry
                              Objectives

                              • Getting familiar with the difference between quotations and orders.
                              • Getting familiar with the difference between alternative quotations and alternative
                                items.
                              • Entering alternative items.
                              • Entering a complete alternative quotation for a quotation.


                              Benefits

                              • An alternative quotation can be used to enter suggestions based on the customer's
                                wishes, and subsequently add those items to the order the customer decides to go
                                ahead with.
                              • You do not have to reenter the data from the quotations to create the
                                corresponding order.


                              Note

                              Quotation                   A quotation is entered in A+W Business under the
                                                          following circumstances:
                                                          • Estimate for the customer
                                                          • Alternative proposals for a future order
                                                          • Price alternatives for replaced sheets, grills, shapes
                                                            and processing steps

                              Document                    Quotations are independent documents.
                                                          There is a separate number area for quotations.
                                                          Quotations can be created in various ways:
                                                          • by copying an order
                                                          • by entering a new document

                              Alternative quotation       Alternative quotations are managed in the quotation
                                                          number area.

                              Default settings            Master data:
                                                          • Number areas
                                                          Company data:
                                                          • System tab (resubmission)
                                                          • Production tab (optimization)

                                      Quotation and Alternatives
                                      The commercial process starts with a quotation. Enter all data with the re-
                                      quired specifications. A+W Business checks - during entry - whether the en-
                                      tered products are available on stock or have to be produced, and whether the
                                      defined restrictions are met. This makes sure that the offered items can be ac-
                                      tually produced.
                                      Quotations are entered in the same way as orders.

                                      Alternative items
                                      For every item, you can enter alternative items that are not included in the
                                      quoted total.
                                      When the customer has accepted a quotation, you can use the copy function
                                      to change it into an order, selecting the required items.

                                      Alternative quotation
                                      In addition to alternative items, you can also create alternative quotations. For
                                      example, you can replace sheets, change, add or delete shapes, grills and
                                      processing steps for items.
                                      When you create an alternative quotation, the data from the document header
                                      will be adopted automatically. You only have to edit the item data. The alterna-
                                      tive quotation can be saved as a separate document.
                                      An overview shows the alternative quotations which have been created for a
                                      quotation.

                                      Resubmission
                                      The dialog Resubmission can be used to view all quotations to be resubmitted
                                      within a certain period.




                                      Fig. C-191   Automatic report at the system start


                                      You can define a resubmission date for every quotation in every order as an
                                      automatic reminder for yourself to contact the customer again.
                                      The resubmission function is described in detail in a separate module.
                                       “Quotation Follow-up” on page C-338

                                      A quotation is a success when it can be turned into an order. You can help this
                                      along by contacting the customer again after having given him time for consid-
                                      eration. You can have the system remind you of open quotations, or have any
                                      open quotations displayed after a defined date.

                                      about.

                                 Financial Accounting (FinAcc)
                                 Objectives

                                 • Settings for data interchange with a financial accounting program.
                                 • Transferring data.
                                 • Checking receivables.


                                 Benefits

                                 • A+W Business can communicate with various FinAcc programs to which you can
                                   transfer invoices.
                                 • Invoices and credit notes can be transferred by means of data transfer.
                                 • Some programs report receivables for customer invoices thus enabling you to
                                   issue reminders or lock a defaulting customer for further orders.


                                 Note

                                 Financial accounting        A+W Business offers interfaces to financial accounting
                                                             (FinAcc) programs.

                                 Automatic data transfer     Data transfer can only be started automatically in
                                                             connection with Syska SQL FinAcc.

                                 Proceeds accounts           A+W Business assigns the proceeds accounts in FinAcc
                                                             to the product groups.

                                 Data transfer               Data will be transferred to a transfer file. You can amend
                                                             the selection of data to be transferred.

                                 Receivables                 The query for receivables (check receivables) only works
                                                             in connection with Syska SQL FinAcc.
                                                             The result of the query lists all unsettled invoices
                                                             including the receivables, reminder date and reminder
                                                             level.

                                 Company codes               If you have defined company codes for your clients in
                                                             your FinAcc program, you can maintain the accounting
                                                             of the individual clients separately.

                                 Default settings            Master data:
                                                             • Status allocation
                                                             • Number areas
                                                             • Finances
                                                             Company data:
                                                             • FinAcc tab
                                                             Utilities:
                                                             • Receivables/accounts payable to FinAcc
                                                             • Receivables

                                      Data Transfer
                                      A+W Business provides interfaces by means of which invoices and credit
                                      notes can be transferred to programs for financial accounting (FinAcc).
                                      Data is transferred to FinAcc via number manager. Data transfer can only be
                                      started automatically in connection with Syska FinAcc.

                                          Automatic data transfer
                                          Data transfer can be automated. There are several options available, e. g.
                                          workflow tasks. Which option you can use depends on your system config-
                                          uration. Should you have any questions regarding this topic, please con-
                                          tact your service contact at A+W Software GmbH.

                                      Transfer of invoices to the FinAcc program is usually triggered manually. The
                                      criteria for data transfer are the same for all invoices.
                                      Documents are analyzed and grouped on two levels:
                                      •   The first level compiles all items and BOM components by their PGR com-
                                          bination for statistics.
                                      •   The second level regroups the result another time. The system searches
                                          for the corresponding proceeds account. Search keys are the product
                                          group, VAT 1, VAT 2 and the document's business type. If there is no such
                                          key, a dialog is displayed in which the proceeds account can be entered.
                                      If a key has no entry for the proceeds account, the blank proceeds account will
                                      be written in the output file.
                                      Special discounts and surcharges of the product type Services and surcharg-
                                      es belonging to product group 000 will not be transferred but (re)distributed to
                                      the corresponding items or BOM components.
4.00 / 04-2020

                                 Status allocation
                                 In status allocation, you define the minimum status a document must have
                                 reached to be transferred to FinAcc.




                                 Fig. C-210   Example: status for FinAcc transfer


                                 You have to define a lock status as well to prevent the document from being
                                 transferred to FinAcc again.

                                 Daily closing
                                 Invoices can be transferred to FinAcc e. g. once a day, in a nightly batch.
                                 When transferred to FinAcc, documents are usually (automatically) trans-
                                 ferred to archives and to statistics as well.
                                 The following settings are required for automatic transfer:
                                 •   Booking periods
                                 •   Paths for the import and export file
                                 •   Work flow task for A+W Business 6 Interface Service
                                 •   Transfer interval or time

                                      Booking periods
                                      Booking periods will be checked during transfer to the FinAcc program. Once
                                      the defined date has been reached, no further documents can be transferred
                                      to the booking period.




                                      Fig. C-211   Booking periods


                                      If a document lies between the date of the first and the date of the next booking
                                      period, A+W Business checks which of the two is closest to the document
                                      date.


                                      Data Transfer File
                                      Data will be transferred to a transfer file. There are several options for adapting
                                      the data transfer, e. g.:
                                      •   Output file
                                      •   Only invoices with a value exceeding 0
                                      •   Automatic sorting
                                      •   Separate handling of tax code
                                      The customer number will be used as an account number by default. If a dif-
                                      ferent invoicing address is entered for the customer in the document, this will
                                      be used as an account number. You can also enter an accounts receivable
                                      number in the customer master data, which shall be transferred as an account
                                      number.
                                      It is possible to transfer free booking text to most of the FinAcc programs. This
                                      is usually the invoicing or customer address (name, street, zip code and
                                      place).

                                 Reports
                                 In its Statistics module, A+W Business offers a number of reports. For this pur-
                                 pose, documents are transferred to statistics. For every document type, you
                                 can define whether and when the corresponding document is to be trans-
                                 ferred.
                                 Documents are simultaneously transferred to statistics and archives. For sta-
                                 tistics, certain order data is saved in a special table in the main database. By
                                 means of the defined deadlines (storage days), the system checks how long
                                 these shall remain in the main database before being automatically deleted.
                                 All data older than the defined deadline will be deleted from the main data-
                                 base. You can define the deadlines by document type yourself.

                                    Example

                                    To create annual overviews, you should enter a long period to have sufficient time
                                    for creating the analysis.
                                    Commission statistics are based on the rhythm in which commissions are
                                    calculated.


                                 Transfer to statistics changes the document status. An example for a change
                                 of status can be found in the training module Status:
                                  “Automatic Status Allocation” on page C-230

                                 Daily closing
                                 Generally, transfer to statistics is based on the month in which the document
                                 was issued, while archiving is based on the year. After archiving, documents
                                 should be deleted to keep the main database as small as possible.
                                 When transferred to FinAcc, documents are usually (automatically) trans-
                                 ferred to archives and to statistics as well.

                                      Archiving
                                      Objectives

                                      • Knowing the differences between main and archives database.
                                      • Making the settings for archiving.
                                      • Manual archiving of documents.


                                      Benefits

                                      • The main database is maintained by the archiving of old orders.
                                      • Archiving and deletion of data at the same time guarantees that the performance of
                                        the main database is maintained.


                                      Note

                                      Documents                   The following documents can be archived:
                                                                  •   Quotations
                                                                  •   Orders
                                                                  •   Credit notes
                                                                  •   Inquiries
                                                                  •   Purchase orders

                                      Archiving year              A+W Business can handle several archiving years. For
                                                                  certain actions, archives can be selected, e. g. for
                                                                  copying documents.

                                      Databases                   In A+W Business, current data is managed in the main
                                                                  database. Apart from that, independent databases are
                                                                  maintained for the archives. These are usually created
                                                                  by calendar year.

                                      Default settings            Company data:
                                                                  • Archives tab
                                                                  • Parameter tab (sales commission)
                                                                  • Daily closing tab (archiving path)

                                 Completed Documents
                                 Completed business transactions will remain in the main database for a de-
                                 fined period after which they are automatically archived. All document data is
                                 saved unchanged. Copies can be loaded from the archives.
                                 Documents are simultaneously transferred to archives and statistics, and sub-
                                 sequently deleted from the main database by default. Upon transfer of the data
                                 to archives, the main database is re-initiated to restore the usual processing
                                 speed.
                                 Since archiving requires a lot of computer capacity, it is carried out every eve-
                                 ning, fully automatic.

                                 Archives
                                 Archives form separate databases, each summarizing a year. At the change
                                 of year, the system archives the documents in the corresponding archives,
                                 based on the invoice date.
                                 Archived documents can be copied back to the main database any time.

                                 Multiple archiving
                                 When an archived document has been copied back to the main database, it
                                 can be archived again only if multiple archiving is activated in the company da-
                                 ta.
                                 If multiple archiving is not permitted, the document has to remain in the main
                                 database or its status must be raised manually so that it can be deleted.

                                 Automatic archiving
                                 Documents are usually archived automatically and deleted afterwards. You
                                 can define a minimum status and the document age in the company data for
                                 this purpose.

                                 Manual archiving
                                 For manual archiving, all documents to be transferred to archives (and/or to
                                 statistics) will be moved to the number manager.
                                 The function Transfer to archives is used to transfer all documents of one num-
                                 ber manager.


                                 Reference Check
                                 When archiving checks the references in the course of deleting documents, it
                                 also checks whether all partial deliveries of the order have been archived. The
                                 order can only be deleted after this has been done.

                                           Document Import
                                           The EDI interfaces are used to import customer orders and edit them in A+W

                                           Master Data for Import
                                           Incoming customer orders will be imported automatically (via batch file); the
                                           system will search for new orders in the corresponding directories at regular
                                           intervals and integrate them in A+W Business order entry. Import can also be
                                           started manually.
                                           Based on the imported data, A+W Business automatically creates orders for
                                           rectangular sheets including grills.
                                            Software Reference, “Import” on page C-683
                                           This requires that master data at the customer's site and in A+W Business are
                                           identical.


                    Example: Identical master data for import

                                    Sender (customer)                                 Recipient (A+W Business)

                    500124 -->                                           500124 -->        • 1004 Float 4 mm
                                                                                           • 105012 AIR 12 mm
                                                                                           • 1004 Float 4 mm

                    500124 -->       105016 AIR 16 mm -->                500124 -->        • 1004 Float 4 mm
                                                                                           • 105016 AIR 16 mm
                                                                                           • 1004 Float 4 mm

                                           This example shows that product 500124 is an IG unit with float 4 mm sheets
                                           and an airspace of 12 mm.
                                           In the second example, the airspace has been replaced by product 105016.
                                           If your customer's master data differs from your own, import is possible by
                                           means of reference tables. The integrated reference function converts the cus-
                                           tomer data to A+W Business data.


                    Example: Converting customer articles in master data

                                  Sender (customer)                                      Recipient (A+W Business)

                    ISO416 -->      • 20004 Float 4 mm             -->      500124 -->       • 1004 Float 4 mm
                                    • 4016 AIR 16 mm                                         • 105016 AIR 12 mm
                                    • 40004 Patterned 4 mm                                   • 1804 Patterned 4 mm

                                           In this example, the alpha-numerical customer article number ISO416 be-
                                           comes the numerical A+W Business product number 500124.
                                           The add-on module Connect II also allows you to import standard shapes.

                                       Document Monitoring
                                       The add-on module Document monitoring checks all documents in A+W Busi-
                                       ness at regular intervals. This function can e.g. consider the following criteria:
                                       •   Quotations due for resubmission.
                                       •   Orders exceeding the customer's credit limit, which have been temporarily
                                           locked for further processing.
                                       •   Orders that have been sent to the customer as order confirmation prior to
                                           a definable time.
                                       •   Orders with Production Release status, to meet the period of objection as
                                           per sent order confirmation.
                                       •   Orders for which the end-of-production date has been exceeded.
                                       •   Orders with Delivery Note status for which no invoice has been issued yet.
                                       This add-on module is started outside the A+W Business application (e.g. C:/
                                       Programs/A+W/A+W/Business/Program/English/abcAutoStatus.exe).
                                       Document monitoring starts automatically. You can define the checking inter-
                                       vals, the document types and respective statuses (check and target status).
                                       The program runs in the background. If documents are found that match the
                                       check criteria, a message to that effect will be issued automatically.

                                       Automatic check for documents entered twice
                                       A+W Business automatically checks when a document is entered or edited
                                       whether another document exists that includes the same product, product
                                       structure and sizes. This check is executed for quotations and orders in the
                                       main database. Archives will not be searched.

                                           Prerequisite
                                           The user status Duplicate existing must have been created in status man-
                                           agement. The monitoring criteria must be defined in the Utilities module.

                                       Should the program find a duplicate, the freshly entered document will be au-
                                       tomatically locked and a message to that extent will be issued. Use the func-
                                       tion Show duplicates to display duplicates of the current document.
                                       Duplicate checks will not be run for complaints, partial shipments and down
                                       payments.

                                      Overview
                                      In Document Management you can enter and edit all the documents you will
                                      need for the sales process. This comprises quotations, orders, delivery notes,
                                      invoices, credit notes, and complaints. This module can also be used to enter
                                      and edit purchase orders.
                                      Documents contain two types of data: information on the customer and the or-
                                      der items. These are entered in separate dialogs.
                                      The Software Reference provides information on the following subjects:
                                      •   Quotation
                                      •   Alternatives
                                      •   Document Management
                                      •   Item Data
                                      •   Overviews and References concerning Header Data
                                      •   Overviews and References concerning Items
                                      •   Copy Documents
                                      •   Macros
                                      •   Number Manager
                                      •   Printing
                                      •   P.O. Transfer
                                      •   Order
                                      •   Transfer, Document Import/Export
                                      •   Analyses
                                      •   Internal Control
                                      •   Credit Note
                                      •   Journal
                                      •   Inventory Lists
                                      •   Reminding
                                      •   Document Data
                                      •   Stock Search

                                        General group
                                        •   Search shipping date by route:
                                            The shipping date is automatically set to the next possible route day.
                                        •   Always calculate purchase price:
                                            The purchase price will always be calculated, even if pricing is disabled in
                                            the Target section.
                                        •   Down payment invoice with items:
                                            Down payment invoices will show the order items.
                                        •   Number area for partial shipments not based on OM area:
                                            The numbers for partial delivery notes do not consider the number area of
                                            the OM areas. The numbers are always loaded from number area <n.s.>.
                                        •   Number area for complaints not based on OM area:
                                            The numbers for complaints do not consider the the number areas of the
                                            OM areas. The numbers are always loaded from number area <n.s.>.
                                        •   Delete stock code if status >= goods withdrawn:
                                            This function is only enabled if you copy a document to a different data-
                                            base. The stock codes will be deleted in this case so as not to change the
                                            stock data in the target database.
                                        •   No shipping fee for partial shipments:
                                            The shipping fee will not be applied to partial shipments, even if the code
                                            for this surcharge has been set in the master data.
                                        •   Complaint quantity matches item quantity:
                                            For complaints, the entire item quantity will be suggested by default.
                                        •   Recreate settings for pricing:
                                            The option Always carry out purchase price pricing is saved user-related
                                            when you exit the dialog. The option will be restored when you open the
                                            dialog again.
                                            If this setting has not been activated, then the option Always carry out pur-
                                            chase price pricing is always deactivated when you open the dialog.
                                        •   Consultant=user:
                                            The Consultant field in the order automatically shows the name of the user
                                            registered in A+W Business or the user who has entered the document.
                                        •   Keep item reference:
                                            References entered in the order will be adopted for the new order automat-
                                            ically.
                                             “Consignment” on page C-452
                                        •   Perform product check:
                                            When copying each item, it is checked whether the main product or a BOM
                                            element is locked or deleted. If this is the case, a corresponding message
                                            will be displayed at the end of the copying process.

                                      Other group
                                      •   No saving of costs:

                                          The cutback from spacers is deducted in the width and height of the order,
                                          however, only if no grills are ordered. In the case of different shape edges,
                                          the cutback is always deducted from the spacer dimension.
                                      •   Always set print code for processing:
                                          Processing steps should always be printed on the P.O.. If this option is dis-
                                          abled, the print codes are adopted from the order into the P.O. without any
                                          changes.
                                      •   Statistics PGR as per order:
                                          The statistics PGR information is adopted from the order if different statis-
                                          tics PGRs have been defined for order and P.O.
                                      •   Business type as per order:
                                          The business type is adopted from the order if different business types
                                          have been defined for order and P.O.
                                      •   OM area as per order:
                                          The OM area is adopted from the order if different OM areas have been de-
                                          fined for order and P.O.
                                      •   Consultant = user for new input:
                                          The P.O. automatically shows the name of the user logged on to A+W Busi-
                                          ness.
                                      •   Check change of status:
                                          The query concerning the change of status is displayed.
                                      •   Repeat transfer only up to lock status:
                                          Purchase orders can be transferred several times but only until lock status
                                          has been reached.
                                      •   Import autom. surcharge code from products:
                                          Always import the surcharge code from the article master data.

                                            Use this tab to check the stock at your storage location(s) and display details

                                               Transfer selection into order
                                               If you have opened the Stock info dialog from item entry, you can transfer
                                               the requested product into the order by double-clicking it.

                                            Selection
                                            The fields show details on the item selected on the list.

                                            Product
                                             Product number by which the product has been entered in the master data.

                                            Type Product type this product has been assigned to in the master data.
4.00 / 04-2020

                 Stock Search                                                                  Software Reference




                                Category If you have defined stock categories in your company, these can
                                be used as filters.
                                 Master Data, “Stock Categories” on page B-738

                                Color (Color) variations that have been defined for the selected product.

                                from, to PGR You can also enter product groups or product group areas.
                                The overview then displays all the products of the selected product groups.

                                Thickness / width / height These details are transferred from stock man-
                                agement. Width and height are only displayed if the selected item has been
                                entered as a stock size or box, including the corresponding details.

                                Storage place If you are using different storage locations, the storage loca-
                                tion of the selected item will be shown, including all defined levels.
                                 Master Data, “Stock Definition” on page B-736

                                Supp. ID Identification number of the shipment from stock management. It is
                                not identical with the entry in the ID column.

                                Comment Information stored for the selected item when delivered.

                                Contents from, to You can use the contents as a search criterion in the se-
                                lection mode, e.g. all boxes with a content of 50 pieces. Contents = 1 always
                                means stock size.

                                Availability Displays the available pieces.

                                Filter options
                                If no filter is set, no stock will be displayed. A filter is set if the corresponding
                                checkbox is ticked. The following filters are available:
                                •   Stock articles:
                                    Stock articles will be displayed.
                                •   Boxes (contents > 1):
                                    Boxes with a content of > 1 will be displayed.
                                •   Stock sizes (contents = 1):
                                    Stock sizes will be shown. Display of the quantity (= 1) helps to distinguish
                                    boxes of identical sizes.
                                •   Articles without sizes:
                                    Even stock articles for which no sizes have been entered will be shown.
                                •   Boxes with IDs:
                                    Boxes entered with an ID at receipt of goods will be shown.
                                •   Minimum qty > 0:
                                    Only stock articles with a minimum quantity of over 0 should be displayed.
                                •   Stock > 0:
                                    Only stock articles with actual stock should be displayed.
                                •   Stock = 0:
4.00 / 04-2020




                                    Only stock articles without stock should be displayed.




                 C-738                                                                       A+W Business Sales
                 Software Reference                                                                    Stock Search




                                      •   Stock < 0:
                                          Only stock articles that have been reserved, but are without stock, should
                                          be displayed.

                                      Print options
                                      You can define the sorting of the list for printing purposes. The appropriate
                                      checkboxes will be enabled with the selected option. You can then additionally
                                      define where a subtotal will be printed.
                                      The following entries are displayed:
                                      •   Group by product no.:
                                          The checkbox Subtotal by product group is enabled.
                                      •   Group by product type/group.:
                                          The Subtotal by super product group checkbox is enabled.
                                      •   Group by product group:
                                          The Subtotal by main product group checkbox is enabled.

                                      Overview
                                      The overview lists all products that have been selected by means of the
                                      search. The columns provide details on the stored products.
                                      The reserved quantities will be updated as soon as a corresponding item has
                                      been saved in the order. The details in column Stock on hand will be updated
                                      when a delivery note is issued.
                                      The entries in the hit list are identified with the following colors:
                                      • Black:
                                         Quantity-based stock article
                                      • Blue:
                                         Stock article not quantity-based
                                      • Red:
                                         – No stock article: articles that are not kept on stock.
                                         – This also applies to products which are no longer available, or which
                                            show negative quantities. There is negative stock if the stock and the
                                            quantity ordered less the reserved quantity are <= 0.

                                      Totals
                                      The totals of the selected products are shown. If you have selected a PGR with
                                      different products, the totals of the selected product are shown.
